_header: I would lend but I ne dare
_description: Verses on the Incommodities of Lending — four couplets

BodRawPoe32.First Lines:
I wold lene but I ne tharI haue be disseuyd I wyll
                    bewar…
BodRawPoe32.Last Lines:
…So off my frend I made my foTher for I will no more do
                    so
BodRawPoe32.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius. 
             “The Prouerbis of Wysdom.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         90 (1893): 241-68: 147-8.

BLHar116.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.316.

BLHar941.First Lines: I wold lene but I ne darreI haue lant I will be warre…
BLHar941.Last Lines: …I pray yo of your gentilnesseReport for no vnkyndnesse

Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.

BLHar2321.Transcription: …when I lent I was a frendwhen I asked I was vnkinde…
BLHar2321.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.208.

BLRoy8Cxii.Transcription:
I wyll lene but I no dar y was be gylede y wyll be warWhen I lend I
                    was a ffrynde when asked I was vn kynde
BLRoy8Cxii.Note: Two verse lines per manuscript line.
